review: I have three Apple TVs.  Although I have enjoyed them, I purchased this Unit for the home office.It really is amazing!  Purchased the additional game controller and that was a definite plus.  What is really amazing are two things in my mind:1 - Voice search!  Gone are the days of using a remote to try to type in movie, song, or TV Show Titles.  Hold the button, say what you are looking for, and BAM.2 - The load time of the content.  I honestly am not sure how it is accomplished, but when you select something to watch, the content loads almost immediately.  Really well built, solid remote, easy set up.
author: JD

review: Great little device!Pros: I love the slim, sleek design so it can be 'hidden' easily. The remote is a nice touch and is also sleek in its design and has voice activation on it. You can install apps like HBOGo, Disney, Netflix, YouTube and more! It has games also and you can purchase a game controller separately or simply use the included remote. You can opt to have a password if you have children which comes in handy so they don't make accidental purchases. Interface is user friendly and it's easy to find shows, movies, and apps... especially since it has voice activation. & lastly, I save so much money not having a cable bill, super plus!Cons: It doesn't have as many shows and movies as Netflix, so if you don't have a subscription to Netflix, then that could be a downside. I had trouble downloading the Netflix app when I first got the fire tv hooked up (note: go to settings, run an update for the fire tv, delete the Netflix app and then reinstall - that worked for me) so far, that's the only cons that I have come across.I haven't had any issues with the wifi, lagging, or anything to that sort. Overall, this product beats Roku by a long haul and I recommend it.
author: Trish

review: Update 6/23/2015: I'm delinquent on updating this review. The Netflix app was fixed a month or so after I initially wrote this review. With that fixed, I give the Fire TV an enthusiastic 5 stars! One of the fun surprise capabilities I stumbled upon is the ability to set the screensaver to show pictures from my Amazon Cloud Drive. After 5 minutes idle, the pics start coming up and that's been a lot of fun.I'm pretty bummed by my Fire TV purchase. I had high hopes given the various reviews, but a key driver for purchasing was to get my Amazon Prime & Netflix choices on one device for ease of use. Unfortunately, Netflix doesn't work on it at all. I saw some people say a recent version of Netflix broke it, but my Fire TV won't even download the application.I have had the Chromecast device for a year and primarily use it for casting various things from my phone. I really like it for that. Adding FTV was a no-brainer based on the reviews to consolidate movie/tv series watching.Things I like about FTV:1. Quick. Navigation doesn't lag. Very smooth. (The more powerful CPU was a motivation to purchase and that was met.)2. Gorgeous pictures on the screen saver. Really impressed!3. Ease of access to Amazon Prime movie/TV content.What I don't like about FTV:1. Netflix not working.Hopefully, the Netflix issue will get straightened out. This is certainly a 4 or 5 star device when this gets corrected.
author: Dave Kennedy "Dave"

review: I purchased two Fire TV Sticks In addition to the Fire TV.  I also use the Roku 2, Roku 3 and Google Chromecast.  Fire TV is superior in some important aspects, for example, the YouTube interface on Fire TV responds better than Roku's.  But there are problems, the biggest of which is that Netflix causes Fire TV to crash once in a while on all three of my Fire TV devices.  Maddening.  Amazon's video services eclipse Netflix on the main interface - which would be fine if they had anything worth watching.  In my demographic (age 60+) it is a poor selection.  Also, more apps are needed.  Fire TV is in its infancy but Amazon is off to a solid start.  A little more work on Amazon's part and I will be giving the Fire TV five stars.
